p: Clathrin-mediated endocytosis of NS1 may have implications beyond NS1-triggered endothelial hyperpermeability. It is known that DENV invades cells via endocytosis [ 44], and pharmacologically blocking clathrin-mediated endocytosis retards DENV replication [ 45]. Further, a recent study demonstrated that DENV NS1 interacts with DENV structural proteins, which modulates infectious viral particle production [ 46]. In light of our finding that NS1 is internalized via clathrin-mediated endocytosis, NS1 could potentially play a role in mediating clathrin-mediated endocytosis of flavivirus virions. Further studies are needed to elucidate, and potentially differentiate, clathrin-mediated endocytosis of virions via the E protein and/or NS1.
